tasks.name: Setting Up and Generating Initial Documentation

parts.content:
Hello {username}! In this module, you've used GitHub Copilot to generate code explanations and project documentation. In this mission, you will be using GitHub Copilot to generate inline code documentation.

Documenting your code is an important aspect of the software development process. Code comments help developers understand the codebase, its purpose, and how to use it.

GitHub Copilot Chat can help you document your code by generating inline code comments. You have the following options:
- Construct a natural language prompt to generate the desired documentation.
- Enter the `/doc` command in the inline chat to generate comments that describe the selected code.
- Use the Generate Docs smart action to generate comments that describe the selected code.
Properly documenting your code creates a more readable and maintainable codebase that's easier for other developers to understand and work with.
In this exercise, you will use GitHub Copilot Chat to generate inline code documentation for the Alfred AI project.
Ensure that you have the Alfred AI project open in Visual Studio Code.
Ready to continue?
Open the `app/api/routes/projects.py` file.
Ready to continue?
Select all the code starting from the import statements to the end of the file.
Ready to continue?
Open the Chat view in Visual Studio Code by selecting 'Chat' from the Activity Bar, or by pressing `Ctrl + Alt + I`.
Ready to continue?

In the Chat view, enter the following prompt:
```python
@workspace #selection generate inline code documentation for the selected code
```
Ready to proceed?
Take a minute to review the suggested code documentation.

https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/reality-ai-b2b-sandbox.appspot.com/o/Program%2FJourney%203%2FModule%202%2FUnit%204%2Fmodule_2_mission_3_1.png?alt=media&token=ad65e4ef-834d-4381-8a04-5130b1e4297e
The response includes suggested code comments that you can manually move into the actual code file.
Ready to proceed?

tasks.name: Generating Documentation Using Inline Chat

parts.content: Now, you will generate inline code documentation using inline chat.
Scroll to the top of the `app/db_models/crud.py` file and select the `create_project` method.
Ready to continue?
To open an inline chat, press `Ctrl + I`.
Ready to continue?

Enter the following prompt:
```python
/doc
```
Ready to proceed?
Take a minute to review the code documentation generated.

https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/reality-ai-b2b-sandbox.appspot.com/o/Program%2FJourney%203%2FModule%202%2FUnit%204%2Fmodule_2_mission_3_2.png?alt=media&token=0349b8f7-e81c-485d-8e2f-0a4d57857c4b

To insert the generated documentation into your code, select Accept. You can always select Discard if you want to reject the suggested update.
Ready to proceed?

parts.content: Next, you will generate inline code documentation using the Generate Docs smart action.
In the Visual Studio Code editor, select the `update_project` method.
Ready to continue?
Right-click the selected code block, select Copilot, and then select Generate Docs.
Ready to continue?
Take a minute to review the suggested code comments.

https://firebasestorage.googleapis.com/v0/b/reality-ai-b2b-sandbox.appspot.com/o/Program%2FJourney%203%2FModule%202%2FUnit%204%2Fmodule_2_mission_3_3.png?alt=media&token=0f474d65-7c0d-423b-b2d6-ba9c7f2f3e0a

Once your review is complete, select Discard. Rather than adding inline comments to each method individually, you can generate comments for the entire class at once.
Ready to proceed?

Open the chat and add the following message:


On the top right of the code block, click on `Insert at Cursor` or use the keyboard shortcut `Ctrl + Enter`.
Review the suggested changes.
